newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Earthquake hits Indonesia's western island.
newsitem.headline: Earthquake hits Indonesia's western island.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 5.9 on the Richter scale was measured on Indonesia's Nias island, off North Sumatra, but there were no reports of casualties or damage, a meteorology official said on Tuesday.

"The earthquake happened at 7.24 p.m. (1224 GMT) on Monday. The quake's epicentre was located in the Indian Ocean 88 km (55 miles) southwest of Gunung Sitoli on Nias island," the official told Reuters.
"We have been informed by the meteorology officials on the island that people on the island had not felt the tremor and there are no reports of casualties," he said.
